Abstract Abstract
This specification defines how an Atom Publishing Protocol collection This specification defines how an Atom Publishing Protocol collection
should process multipart/related requests and also defines how a should process multipart/related requests and also defines how a
service announces that it accepts multipart/related entities. service announces that it accepts multipart/related entities.

mailing list (http://www.imc.org/atom-protocol/) [1]. mailing list (http://www.imc.org/atom-protocol/) [1].

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
The Atom Publishing Protocol [RFC5023] defines Media Collections and The Atom Publishing Protocol [RFC5023] defines Media Collections and
how to create a Media Resource by POSTing the media to the Media how to create a Media Resource by POSTing the media to the Media
Collection. RFC 5023 does not define handling multipart/related Collection. RFC 5023 does not define handling multipart/related
[RFC2387] represenatations nor does it specify how the acceptance of [RFC2387] represenatations nor does it specify how the acceptance of
such representations should be advertised in the Service Document. such representations should be advertised in the Service Document.
skipping to change at page 4, line 9 skipping to change at page 4, line 9
PUT of a multipart/related representation. PUT of a multipart/related representation.
2. Terminology 2. Terminology
The terms Collection, Media Resource, Media Link Entry, and Service The terms Collection, Media Resource, Media Link Entry, and Service
Document are used as defined in [RFC5023]. Document are used as defined in [RFC5023].
3. Multipart Representations 3. Multipart Representations
This section covers the constraints on a multipart/related This section covers the constraints on a multipart/related
representation sent to a Media Collection. Section 4 covers how a representation sent to a Media Collection. Section 5 covers how a
client discovers that a Media Collection accepts multipart/related client discovers that a Media Collection accepts multipart/related
representations. representations.
This specification defines a format for multipart/related
representations sent to a Media Collection. There may be other
specifications that define formats for multipart representations, as
such this specification will only cover what constitutes a valid
representation for this specification. Follow-on multipart/related
specifications will have to define a method by which a server can
differentiate which specification is in force, which is beyond the
scope of this document.
A multipart/related POST to a Media Collection MUST be a valid A multipart/related POST to a Media Collection MUST be a valid
multipart/related representation as defined by [RFC2387] and MUST multipart/related representation as defined by [RFC2387] and MUST
contain two body parts. One body part MUST be an Atom Entry with a contain two body parts. One body part MUST be an Atom Entry with a
media type of 'application/atom+xml' or 'application/ media type of 'application/atom+xml' or 'application/
atom+xml;type=entry'. The other body part MUST be of a media type atom+xml;type=entry'. The other body part MUST be of a media type
acceptable to the collection. The order of the body parts and which acceptable to the collection. The object root MUST be the Media Link
one is the 'root' object are not relavant and an AtomPub service MUST Entry. The Media Link Entry atom:content element MUST have a 'src'
accept otherwise valid multipart/related POST representations in attribute whose value is the URI of the related media contained in
either order. the compound object. The 'src' attribute value MUST be a 'cid:' URI
as defined by [RFC2392]. The Content-Type: header of the POST
request MUST have a value of "application/atom+xml;type=entry" or
"application/atom+xml" for its required type parameter.
That is, if a client is creating a media resource of type image/png 4. Server Processing
it can either POST a multipart/related representation with a type
parameter of either "application/atom+xml;type=entry" or "image/png".
If the optional start parameter is provided it MAY point, via
Content-ID, to either the image/png or the application/atom+xml
object.
A successful POST of a multipart/related representation to a Media A successful POST of a multipart/related representation to a Media
Collection proceeds as any successful Media Resource creation. The Collection proceeds as any successful Media Resource creation. The
non-Atom object is used to create the Media Resource and the Atom non-Atom object is used to create the Media Resource and the Atom
Entry object is used to create the Media Link Entry. Media Resource Entry object is used to create the Media Link Entry. Media Resource
creation proceeds as defined in Section 9.6 of [RFC5023] with a creation proceeds as defined in Section 9.6 of [RFC5023] with a
successful creation returning a 201 status code and a Location: successful creation returning a 201 status code and a Location:
header pointing to the newly created Media Link Entry. All other header pointing to the newly created Media Link Entry. All other
aspects of [RFC5023] MUST be followed for Media Resource creation aspects of [RFC5023] MUST be followed for Media Resource creation
including Slug: header processing. including Slug: header processing.
While a multipart/related request replaces three round trips in the While a multipart/related request replaces three round trips in the
typical Media Resource creation scenario, AtomPub has no mechanism to typical Media Resource creation scenario, AtomPub has no mechanism to
report partial success and the handling of a multipart/related report partial success and the handling of a multipart/related
request by the server MUST be atomic; it should either succeed with a request by the server MUST be atomic; it should either succeed with a
201 Created status code, or return an error status code. 201 Created status code, or return an error status code.
4. Service Document Extension 5. Service Document Extension
An AtomPub service announces that it will accept multipart/related An AtomPub service announces that it will accept multipart/related
POSTs by an extension to the app:accept element. The 'multipart' POSTs by an extension to the app:accept element. The 'alternate'
attribute is boolean valued, either "yes" or "no", and a "yes" attribute is a spaced separated list of tokens. The only token
defined by this specification is "multipart-related". The presence
of the "multipart-related" token in the 'alternate' attribute
indicates that the collection accepts multipart/related POSTs for the indicates that the collection accepts multipart/related POSTs for the
value of the app:accept element. The following example indicates a value of the app:accept element. The following example indicates a
collection that allows the creation of resources with the Ogg collection that allows the creation of resources with the Ogg
Bitstream Format and will also accept them in multipart form. Bitstream Format and will also accept them in multipart form.
<app:accept multipart="yes">application/ogg</app:accept> <app:accept alternate="multipart-related">application/ogg</app:accept>
The 'multipart' attribute is foreign markup and will be ignored by The 'multipart' attribute is foreign markup and will be ignored by
clients that do not understand multipart/related uploads. In clients that do not understand multipart/related uploads. In
addition it permits the full range of the app:accept element to be addition it permits the full range of the app:accept element to be
used. The following indicates that the collection accepts any image used. The following indicates that the collection accepts any image
media type and will also accept them in multipart form. media type and will also accept them in multipart form.
<app:accept multipart="yes">image/*</app:accept> <app:accept alternate="multipart-related">image/*</app:accept>
The 'multipart' attribute can only have values of "yes" or "no". If The default is collections do not accept multipart/related
not present the client MUST interpret the app:accept element as if representations.
the multipart attribute were present and had the value "no".
The 'multipart' attribute allows clients that are unaware of The 'alternate' attribute allows clients that are unaware of
multipart/related to continue to operate as normal since the multipart/related to continue to operate as normal since the
multipart attribute is foreign markup. The alternative, which was to alternate attribute is foreign markup. The alternative, which was to
put a multipart/related media type in the app:accept element loses put a multipart/related media type in the app:accept element loses
flexibility since the 'type' parameter to the multipart/related media flexibility since the 'type' parameter to the multipart/related media
type accepts only media types and not media ranges. type accepts only media types and not media ranges.
5. Examples 6. Examples
Here is an example service document that contains two media Here is an example service document that contains two media
collections. The first collection accepts multipart/related POSTs collections. The first collection accepts multipart/related POSTs
for video media types only. The second collection accepts multipart/ for video media types only. The second collection accepts multipart/
related POSTs for image/jpeg and image/png media types. related POSTs for image/jpeg and image/png media types.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding='utf-8'?> <?xml version="1.0" encoding='utf-8'?>
<service xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2007/app" <service xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2007/app"
xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
<workspace> <workspace>
<atom:title>Media Collections</atom:title> <atom:title>Media Collections</atom:title>
<collection <collection
href="http://example.org/blog/main" > href="http://example.org/blog/main" >
<atom:title>Mostly Media</atom:title> <atom:title>Mostly Media</atom:title>
<accept multipart="yes">video/*</accept> <accept alternate="multipart-related">video/*</accept>
<accept multipart="no" >text/*</accept> <accept alternate="" >text/*</accept>
<accept >audio/*</accept> <accept >audio/*</accept>
</collection> </collection>
<collection <collection
href="http://example.org/blog/pic" > href="http://example.org/blog/pic" >
<atom:title>Pictures Only</atom:title> <atom:title>Pictures Only</atom:title>
<accept multipart="yes">image/png</accept> <accept alternate="multipart-related">image/png</accept>
<accept multipart="yes">image/gif</accept> <accept alternate="multipart-related">image/gif</accept>
</collection> </collection>
</workspace> </workspace>
</service> </service>
Here is an example interaction of a client creating a new Media Here is an example interaction of a client creating a new Media
Resource in the Pictures Only media collection using a png image in a Resource in the Pictures Only media collection using a png image in a
multipart/related representation. multipart/related representation.
POST /blog/pic HTTP/1.1 POST /blog/pic HTTP/1.1
Host: example.org Host: example.org
Content-Length: nnnn Content-Length: nnnn
content-type: multipart/related; content-type: multipart/related;
boundary="===============1605871705==" boundary="===============1605871705=="
type="application/atom+xml"
slug: The Beach slug: The Beach
mime-version: 1.0 mime-version: 1.0
Media Post Media Post
--===============1605871705== --===============1605871705==
Content-Type: application/atom+xml; charset="utf-8" Content-Type: application/atom+xml; charset="utf-8"
MIME-Version: 1.0 MIME-Version: 1.0
<?xml version="1.0"?> <?xml version="1.0"?>
<entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
skipping to change at page 8, line 28 skipping to change at page 8, line 28
A nice sunset picture over the water. A nice sunset picture over the water.
</summary> </summary>
<content type="image/png" <content type="image/png"
src="http://media.example.org/the_beach.png"/> src="http://media.example.org/the_beach.png"/>
<link rel="edit-media" <link rel="edit-media"
href="http://media.example.org/edit/the_beach.png" /> href="http://media.example.org/edit/the_beach.png" />
<link rel="edit" <link rel="edit"
href="http://example.org/media/edit/the_beach.atom" /> href="http://example.org/media/edit/the_beach.atom" />
</entry> </entry>
